CONSULTANCY AGREEMENT

THIS AGREEMENT is dated {{#doc_var name="document_date" _class="datepicker"}} Date of Agreement {{/doc_var}} and is made BETWEEN:

{{#doc_var name="first_company_name"}} First Company name {{/doc_var}} a company incorporated under the Companies Acts with registered number {{#doc_var name="first_company_number"}} First Company number {{/doc_var}} and having its registered office at {{#doc_var name="first_company_address"}} First Company address {{/doc_var}} ("the Company"); and

{{#doc_var name="second_company_name"}} Second Company name {{/doc_var}} a company incorporated under the Companies Acts with registered number {{#doc_var name="second_company_number"}} Second Company number {{/doc_var}} and having its registered office at {{#doc_var name="second_company_address"}} Second Company address {{/doc_var}} ("the Consultancy")

WHEREAS the Company wishes to benefit from the skills and abilities of the Consultancy and the Consultancy has agreed to provide services to the Company on the following terms and conditions.

IT IS AGREED as follows:

  1. ENGAGEMENT
    1. The Company shall engage the Consultancy and the Consultancy shall act for the Company on the terms and conditions set out in this Agreement.
    2. The Consultancy shall provide services through {{#doc_var name="representative"}} REPRESENTATIVE {{/doc_var}} based at {{#doc_var name="representative_address"}} ADDRESS OF REPRESENTATIVE {{/doc_var}} ("the Representative") or such other person as may be mutually agreed between the Company and the Consultancy.
    3. The relationship of the Consultancy to the Company will be that of independent contractor and at no time will the Consultancy or the Representative hold itself/ {{#doc_choice name="my_variable_name" choices="himself, herself" is_static=true}}{{/doc_choice}} out as being an employee or agent of the Company or any subsidiary company. The Consultancy and the Representative shall not have any right or power to contract on behalf of the Company or any subsidiary company or bind the Company or any subsidiary company in any way in relation to third parties unless specifically authorised to do so by the Board of Directors of the Company ("the Board").
  2. TERM

    {{#doc_select name="commencement_date"}} The Consultancy's engagement shall commence on {{#doc_var name="document_date_2" _class="datepicker"}} COMMENCEMENT DATE {{/doc_var}} and shall continue (subject to the terms of this Agreement) for a fixed period of {{#doc_var name="period"}} PERIOD {{/doc_var}}. {option} The Consultancy's engagement shall commence on {{#doc_var name="document_date_3" _class="datepicker"}} COMMENCEMENT DATE {{/doc_var}} and shall continue (subject to the terms of this Agreement) until terminated by either party giving to the other not less than {{#doc_var name="termination_notice_period"}} TERMINATION NOTICE {{/doc_var}} months notice in writing. {{/doc_select}}

  3. DUTIES
    1. The duties of the Consultancy shall be {{#doc_var name="duties"}} DUTIES {{/doc_var}} and shall be carried out at the Company's offices at {{#doc_var name="place_of_work"}} PLACE OF WORK {{/doc_var}} or at such other location or locations as may be necessary for the proper performance of the duties.
    2. Except at such times as the Representative may be prevented by illness or injury, the Consultancy shall procure that the Representative, when providing the services, shall devote such time, attention and skill as may be required for the proper discharge of the duties.
    3. The Consultancy will not during the engagement undertake any additional engagements which would interfere with or preclude the performance of the duties under this Agreement or which may lead to a conflict of interest between the Consultancy and the best interests of the Company or any subsidiary company and shall not accept any employment or engagement which is similar to or in any way competitive with any business of the Company or any subsidiary company without the prior written consent of the Board.
  4. FEES
    1. In consideration of the services, the Company shall pay the Consultancy a fee at the rate of {{#doc_var name="fee_rate"}} sickness FEE RATE {{/doc_var}} per month exclusive of Value Added Tax (VAT) payable monthly in arrears.
    2. The Consultancy shall render to the Company monthly invoices in respect of fees to include VAT where necessary.
    3. The Consultancy shall be reimbursed in full by the Company in respect of all expenses properly and reasonably incurred by it in connection with the performance of the duties under this Agreement, subject to the production of such receipts as the Company may require.
    4. The Consultancy shall be responsible for all income tax liabilities and National Insurance or similar contributions in respect of fees and the Consultancy shall indemnify the Company in respect of any such payments required to be made by the Company and the Company shall be entitled to deduct the same from the fees and expenses due to the Consultancy.
    5. In the event that the Representative is prevented from performing {{#doc_choice name="my_variable_name" choices="his, her" is_static=true}}{{/doc_choice}} duties as a result of illness or injury the Consultancy shall, notwithstanding such {{#doc_choice name="my_variable_name" choices="his, her" is_static=true}}{{/doc_choice}} incapacity, be entitled to receive the fees referred to in Clause 4.1 provided if such incapacity shall endure for a continuous period of or aggregate period of {{#doc_var name="sickness_ period"}} sickness SICKNESS PERIOD {{/doc_var}} days or more in any consecutive period of 12 months the Company shall not be obliged to make any further payment of such fee and shall be entitled to terminate this Agreement by giving the Consultancy {{#doc_var name="sickness_termination_notice_period"}} sickness TERMINATION NOTICE {{/doc_var}} months notice in writing.
    6. The Consultancy shall be responsible for the payment of all remuneration and any benefits due to or in respect of the Representative under {{#doc_choice name="my_variable_name" choices="his, her" is_static=true}}{{/doc_choice}} contract of employment or engagement with the Consultancy or otherwise, including any National Insurance, income tax and any other form of taxation or social security costs in respect of {{#doc_choice name="my_variable_name" choices="his, her" is_static=true}}{{/doc_choice}} remuneration or benefits.
  5. LIABILITY

    The Consultancy shall exercise all reasonable skill, care and attention in all matters and shall indemnify the Company or any subsidiary from any and all costs, claims, liabilities and expenses incurred in respect of the Consultancy’s performance (or non-performance) of its duties.

  6. INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY RIGHTS
    1. The Consultancy shall communicate to the Company full details of all information which results from the duties (including any inventions or developments which are made or conceived by the Consultancy) ("the Results") during the term of the consultancy or within 6 months after its end.
    2. {{#doc_select name="intellectual_property_rights"}} Upon termination of the duties the Consultancy shall assign all rights, title and interest (including all intellectual property rights) in the Results to the Company with full title guarantee. The Consultancy shall without further remuneration but at the Company's expense execute all documents and do all acts and things which the Company at any time during or after the consultancy requires to obtain or maintain any patents or other protection in respect of the Results in any part of the world or to vest the Results in the Company. {option} Copyright in the Results is owned by the Consultancy. Upon termination of the duties the Consultancy shall grant to the Company a royalty-free, world-wide, non-exclusive licence to use the Results. All intellectual property rights shall not be transferred to the Company and shall remain the property of the Consultancy. {{/doc_select}}
  7. TERMINATION
    1. The Company shall be entitled to terminate this Agreement with immediate effect and without any payment in lieu of notice by giving notice in writing to the Consultancy in the event of any of the following:
      1. if the Consultancy or the Representative is guilty of serious misconduct or other conduct calculated or likely to affect prejudicially the interest of the Company or any subsidiary company; or
      2. if the Consultancy becomes insolvent or any order is made or resolution passed for the winding up of the Consultancy or a receiver is appointed in respect of the Consultancy or any of its assets or the Consultancy enters into any scheme or arrangement for the benefit of its creditors;
      3. if the Consultancy commits any material or persistent breach of any of the terms or conditions of this Agreement or shall wilfully neglect or refuse to carry out any of the duties or to comply with any instruction given by the Board; or
      4. if the Consultancy shall be convicted of any offence involving any act of fraud or dishonesty.
    3. Upon termination of the engagement the Consultancy shall not represent itself as being engaged by or connected with the Company or any subsidiary company.
  8. CONFIDENTIALITY
    1. The Consultancy shall, and shall procure that the Representative shall, at all times keep secret and confidential all information relating to the Company, its business, finances and affairs or that of any of its subsidiaries and the projects, business, finances and affairs of its clients or customers.
    2. The Consultancy shall, on termination of this Agreement for any reason whatever, forthwith deliver up to the Company all tangible materials relating to the matters specified in Clause 6.1, and shall in addition, if so requested by the Company, disclose to and inform the Company to the fullest extent of all information, calculations, data, technology and know-how of any description known to the Consultancy in any way relating to or in connection with such matters and their current state or future proposals or development to enable the same to be continued or developed to their fullest extent.
  9. NOTICES
    1. Any notice required or permitted to be given or served under this Agreement shall be in writing and may be served by either party by personal service or by post addressed to the other party's registered office for the time being.
    2. Any such notice shall be deemed to have been served
      1. if delivered, at the time of delivery; or
      2. if posted, at the expiry of 48 hours after posting.
  10. WAIVERS AND REMEDIES
    1. The rights of each party under this Agreement may be exercised as often as necessary and are cumulative and not exclusive of its rights under the general law.
    2. No waiver of any of the provisions of this Agreement shall be effective unless it is expressly stated to be such in writing and signed by both parties.
    3. Any delay in exercising or non-exercise of any right is not a waiver of that right.
    4. Any remedy or right conferred upon the parties for breach of this Agreement shall be in addition to and without prejudice to all other rights and remedies available to it.
  11. SEVERABILITY

    If any provision of this Agreement is held invalid, illegal or unenforceable in any jurisdiction, such provision shall be severed and the remainder of the provisions of this Agreement shall continue in full force and effect as if this Agreement had been executed with the illegal or unenforceable provision eliminated.

  12. REPRESENTATIONS

    The Consultancy warrants and represents to the Company that it is under no obligation, covenant or restriction which would or might operate to prevent or restrict the Consultancy from performing the obligations under this Agreement or which may give rise to any conflict of interest between the Consultancy and the Company or any subsidiary company.

THIS AGREEMENT is dated {{#doc_var name="document_date" _class="datepicker"}} Date of Agreement {{/doc_var}} and is made BETWEEN:

{{#doc_var name=" company_name"}} Company name {{/doc_var}} a company incorporated under the Companies Acts with registered number {{#doc_var name="company_number"}} Company number {{/doc_var}} and having its registered office at {{#doc_var name="company_address"}} Company address {{/doc_var}} ("the Company"); and

{{#doc_var name="consultant_name"}} NAME OF CONSULTANT {{/doc_var}} residing at {{#doc_var name="consutant_address"}} ADDRESS OF CONSULTANT {{/doc_var}} ("the Consultant")

IT IS AGREED as follows:

  1. ENGAGEMENT
    1. The Company shall engage the Consultant and the Consultant shall act for the Company on the terms and conditions set out in this Agreement.
    2. The relationship of the Consultant to the Company will be that of independent contractor and at no time will the Consultant hold himself out as being an employee or agent of the Company or any subsidiary company. The Consultant shall have no right or power to contract on behalf of the Company or any subsidiary company or bind the Company or any subsidiary company in any way in relation to third parties unless specifically authorised to do so by the Board of Directors of the Company ("the Board").
  2. TERM

    {{#doc_select name="commencement_date"}} The Consultant's engagement shall commence on {{#doc_var name="document_date" _class="datepicker"}} COMMENCEMENT DATE {{/doc_var}} and shall continue (subject to the terms of this Agreement) for a fixed period of {{#doc_var name="period"}} PERIOD {{/doc_var}}. {option} The Consultant's engagement shall commence on {{#doc_var name="document_date" _class="datepicker"}} COMMENCEMENT DATE {{/doc_var}} and shall continue (subject to the terms of this Agreement) until terminated by either party giving to the other not less than {{#doc_var name="termination_notice_period"}} TERMINATION NOTICE {{/doc_var}} months notice in writing. {{/doc_select}}

  3. DUTIES
    1. The duties of the Consultant shall be {{#doc_var name="duties"}} DUTIES {{/doc_var}} and shall be carried out at the Company's offices at {{#doc_var name="place_of_work"}} PLACE OF WORK {{/doc_var}} or at such other location or locations as may be necessary for the proper performance of {{#doc_choice name="sex_choice" choices="his, her" is_static=true}}{{/doc_choice}} duties.
    2. Except at such times as the Consultant may be prevented by illness or injury, the Consultant shall devote such time, attention and skill as may be required for the proper discharge of {{#doc_choice name="sex_choice" choices="his, her" is_static=true}}{{/doc_choice}} duties and shall use {{#doc_choice name="sex_choice" choices="his, her" is_static=true}}{{/doc_choice}} best endeavours to promote the interests of the Company.
    3. The Consultant will not during {{#doc_choice name="sex_choice" choices="his, her" is_static=true}}{{/doc_choice}} engagement undertake any additional engagements which would interfere with or preclude the performance of {{#doc_choice name="sex_choice" choices="his, her" is_static=true}}{{/doc_choice}} duties under this Agreement or which may lead to a conflict of interest between the Consultant and the best interests of the Company or any subsidiary company and shall not accept any employment or engagement which is similar to or in any way competitive with any business of the Company or any subsidary company without the prior written consent of the Board.
  4. FEES
    1. In consideration of {{#doc_choice name="sex_choice" choices="his, her" is_static=true}}{{/doc_choice}} services, the Company shall pay the Consultant a fee at the rate of {{#doc_var name="fee_rate"}} sickness FEE RATE {{/doc_var}}per month exclusive of Value Added Tax payable monthly in arrears.
    2. The Consultant shall render to the Company monthly invoices in respect of {{#doc_choice name="sex_choice" choices="his, her" is_static=true}}{{/doc_choice}} fees to include VAT where necessary.
    3. The Consultant shall be reimbursed in full by the Company in respect of all expenses properly and reasonably incurred by {{#doc_choice name="sex_choice" choices="his, her" is_static=true}}{{/doc_choice}} in connection with the performance of {{#doc_choice name="sex_choice" choices="his, her" is_static=true}}{{/doc_choice}} duties under this Agreement, subject to the production of such receipts as the Company may require.
    4. The Consultant shall be responsible for all income tax liabilities and National Insurance or similar contributions in respect of {{#doc_choice name="sex_choice" choices="his, her" is_static=true}}{{/doc_choice}} fees and the Consultant shall indemnify the Company in respect of any such payments required to be made by the Company and the Company shall be entitled to deduct the same from the fees and expenses due to the Consultant.
    5. In the event that the Consultant is prevented from performing {{#doc_choice name="sex_choice" choices="his, her" is_static=true}}{{/doc_choice}} duties as a result of illness or injury the Consultant shall, notwithstanding such incapacity, be entitled to receive the fees referred to in Clause 4.1 provided if such incapacity shall endure for a continuous period of or aggregate period of {{#doc_var name="sickness_ period"}} sickness SICKNESS PERIOD {{/doc_var}}days or more in any consecutive period of 12 months the Company shall not be obliged to make any further payment of such fee and shall be entitled to terminate this Agreement by giving the Consultant {{#doc_var name="sickness_termination_notice_period"}} sickness TERMINATION NOTICE {{/doc_var}} months notice in writing.
  5. LIABILITY

    The Consultant shall exercise all reasonable skill, care and attention in all matters and shall indemnify the Company or any subsidiary company from any and all costs, claims, liabilities and expenses incurred in respect of the Consultant's performance (or non-performance) of {{#doc_choice name="sex_choice" choices="his, her" is_static=true}}{{/doc_choice}} duties.

  6. INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY RIGHTS
    1. The Consultant shall communicate to the Company full details of all information which results from the duties (including any inventions or developments which are made or conceived by the Consultant) ("the Results") during the term of the Consultancy or within 6 months after its end.
    2. {{#doc_select name="intellectual_property_rights"}} IF COMPANY RETAINS IPR Upon termination of the duties the Consultant shall assign all rights, title and interest (including all intellectual property rights) in the Results to the Company with full title guarantee. The Consultant shall without further remuneration but at the Company's expense execute all documents and do all acts and things which the Company at any time during or after the Consultancy requires to obtain or maintain any patents or other protection in respect of the Results in any part of the world or to vest the Results in the Company.
    3. {option}
    4. Copyright in the Results is owned by the Consultant. Upon termination of the duties the Consultant shall grant to the Company a royalty-free, world-wide, non-exclusive licence to use the Results. All intellectual property rights shall not be transferred to the Company and shall remain the property of the Consultant. {{/doc_select}}
  7. TERMINATION
    1. The Company shall be entitled to terminate this Agreement with immediate effect and without any payment in lieu of notice by giving notice in writing to the Consultant in the event of any of the following:
      1. if the Consultant is guilty of serious misconduct or other conduct calculated or likely to affect prejudicially the interest of the Company or any subsidiary company; or
      2. if the Consultant becomes insolvent or bankrupt or enters into any composition or arrangement with or for the benefit of {{#doc_choice name="sex_choice" choices="his, her" is_static=true}}{{/doc_choice}} creditors; or
      3. if the Consultant commits any material or persistent breach of any of the terms or conditions of this Agreement or shall wilfully neglect or refuse to carry out any of {{#doc_choice name="sex_choice" choices="his, her" is_static=true}}{{/doc_choice}} duties or to comply with any instruction given to {{#doc_choice name="sex_choice" choices="his, her" is_static=true}}{{/doc_choice}} by the Board; or
      4. if the Consultant shall be convicted of any offence involving any act of fraud or dishonesty.
      5. Upon termination of the engagement under this Agreement the Consultant shall not represent {{#doc_choice name="sex_choice" choices="himself, herself" is_static=true}}{{/doc_choice}} as being engaged by or connected with the Company or any subsidiary company.
  8. CONFIDENTIALITY
    1. The Consultant shall at all times keep secret and confidential all information relating to the Company, its business, finances and affairs or that of any of its subsidiaries and the projects, business, finances and affairs of its clients or customers.
    2. The Consultant shall, on termination of this Agreement for any reason whatever, forthwith deliver up to the Company all tangible materials relating to the matters specified in Clause 6.1, and shall in addition, if so requested by the Company, disclose to and inform the Company to the fullest extent of all information, calculations, data, technology and know-how of any description known to {{#doc_choice name="sex_choice" choices="him, her" is_static=true}}{{/doc_choice}} in any way relating to or in connection with such matters and their current state or future proposals or development to enable the same to be continued or developed to their fullest extent.
  9. NOTICES
    1. Any notice required or permitted to be given or served under this Agreement shall be in writing and may be served by either party by personal service or by post addressed to, in the case of the Company, its registered office and in the case of the Consultant, the address stated in this Agreement, or such other address as the Consultant may hereafter intimate in writing to the Company.
    2. Any such notice shall be deemed to have been served
      1. if delivered, at the time of delivery; or
      2. if posted, at the expiry of 48 hours after posting.
  10. WAIVERS AND REMEDIES
    1. The rights of each party under this Agreement may be exercised as often as necessary and are cumulative and not exclusive of its rights under the general law.
    2. No waiver of any of the provisions of this Agreement shall be effective unless it is expressly stated to be such in writing and signed by both parties.
    3. Any delay in exercising or non-exercise of any right is not a waiver of that right.
    4. Any remedy or right conferred upon the parties for breach of this Agreement shall be in addition to and without prejudice to all other rights and remedies available to it.
  11. SEVERABILITY

    If any provision of this Agreement is held invalid, illegal or unenforceable in any jurisdiction, such provision shall be severed and the remainder of the provisions of this Agreement shall continue in full force and effect as if this Agreement had been executed with the illegal or unenforceable provision eliminated.

  12. REPRESENTATIONS

    The Consultant warrants and represents to the Company that {{#doc_choice name="sex_choice" choices="he, she" is_static=true}}{{/doc_choice}} is under no obligation, covenant or restriction which would or might operate to prevent or restrict the Consultant from performing {{#doc_choice name="sex_choice" choices="his, her" is_static=true}}{{/doc_choice}} obligations under this Agreement or which may give rise to any conflict of interest between the Consultant and the Company or any subsidiary company.

  13. ENTIRE AGREEMENT

    This Agreement constitutes the entire understanding and agreement between the parties relating to the subject matter of this Agreement and supersedes any previous agreement between the parties.

  14. GOVERNING LAW AND JURISDICTION

THIS AGREEMENT is made on the {{#doc_var name="agreement_date" _class="datepicker"}} DATE OF AGREEMENT {{/doc_var}} between

{{#doc_var name="first_party"}}NAME OF FIRST PARTY {{/doc_var}} residing at {{#doc_var name="first_party_address"}} ADDRESS OF FIRST PARTY{{/doc_var}} ("the Borrower"); and

{{#doc_var name="second_party"}}NAME OF SECOND PARTY {{/doc_var}} residing at {{#doc_var name="second_party_address"}} ADDRESS OF SECOND PARTY{{/doc_var}} ("the Borrower") ("the Lender")

WHEREAS:

The Lender has agreed to lend to the Borrower the sum of {{#doc_var name="loan_amount"}}loan amount{{/doc_var}} ("the Loan").

IT IS AGREED as follows:

  1. On the execution of this Agreement the Lender agrees to make the Loan to the Borrower on the terms and conditions of this Agreement.
  2. The Lender shall be entitled to call for repayment of the Loan on demand at any time but without prejudice to this entitlement shall accept repayment in the manner outlined below.
  3. Interest on the Loan shall be calculated at a monthly rate of one twelfth of a nominal annual rate, the nominal annual rate being {{#doc_var name="interest_rate"}}INTEREST RATE{{/doc_var}} per cent per annum above the published annual base rate from time to time of the Bank of England, and shall be charged on the balance of the Loan outstanding on a monthly basis. Said interest shall be payable by the Borrower to the Lender monthly in arrears.
  4. Repayment of the Loan shall be by monthly instalments in respect of principal and interest in the amount of {{#doc_var name="monthly_payment"}} MONTHLY AMOUNT {{/doc_var}} and shall be made by Banker's Order, first payment due one month from the date of this Agreement. Such monthly payment shall be apportioned firstly towards payment of interest due and secondly towards repayment of the principal sum outstanding.
    1. The monthly instalments of {{#doc_var name="monthly_payment"}} MONTHLY AMOUNT {{/doc_var}} have been calculated to allow the Loan and interest thereon to be repaid in full within {{#doc_var name="loan_term"}} LOAN TERM {{/doc_var}} months, assuming that the average annual base rate of interest is {{#doc_var name="interest_rate"}}INTEREST RATE{{/doc_var}} per cent above the published annual base rate of the Bank of England, per annum but the Lender gives no warranty as to the future level of said base rate. The published base rate of said bank being {{#doc_var name="BASE_rate"}}BASE RATE{{/doc_var}} per cent as at the date on which this agreement is made.
    2. If said base rate increases at any time after the date of this Agreement to a level which if continued for the remainder of the term of the Loan would mean that the monthly instalments of {{#doc_var name="monthly_payment"}} MONTHLY AMOUNT {{/doc_var}} are insufficient to repay the Loan and interest in full within {{#doc_var name="loan_term"}} LOAN TERM {{/doc_var}} months, then the Lender may by notice in writing to the Borrower require the Borrower to increase the monthly instalments to such a level as to allow the Loan and the interest thereon to be repaid within said {{#doc_var name="loan_term"}} LOAN TERM {{/doc_var}} months (to commence with the payment after such notice) or may extend the repayment period by mutual agreement.
    3. If the base rate decreases at any time after the date of this Agreement then the monthly instalments shall be reduced to such a level as to allow the Loan and the interest thereon to be repaid within said {{#doc_var name="loan_term"}} LOAN TERM {{/doc_var}} months (to commence with the payment after such notice) or may reduce the repayment period to allow the Loan to be discharged prior to the expiration of the term of {{#doc_var name="loan_term"}} LOAN TERM {{/doc_var}} months by mutual agreement.
  6. Notwithstanding the provisions of Clause 5 the Borrower may repay the Loan and interest accrued thereon at any time after the date of this Agreement by giving {{#doc_var name="prepayment_penalty"}}NOTICE{{/doc_var}} months' notice in writing to the Lender or upon paying {{#doc_var name="prepayment_penalty"}}NOTICE{{/doc_var}} months' interest in lieu of notice. IN WITNESS WHEREOF these presents are executed on the date before written:

Partnership Agreement
THIS AGREEMENT is made on the {{#doc_var name="agreement_date"}} DATE OF AGREEMENT {{/doc_var}} BETWEEN

{{#doc_select name="partner_details" label="Partners" multi=true}} {{#doc_var name="first_partner_name"}} PARTNER 1 {{/doc_var}} residing at {{#doc_var name="first_partner_address"}} ADDRESS 1 {{/doc_var}} and

{option} {{#doc_var name="second_partner_name"}} PARTNER 2 {{/doc_var}} residing at {{#doc_var name="second_partner_address"}} ADDRESS 2 {{/doc_var}} and

{option} {{#doc_var name="third_partner_name"}} PARTNER 3 {{/doc_var}} residing at {{#doc_var name="third_partner_address"}} ADDRESS 3 {{/doc_var}} and

{option} {{#doc_var name="fourth_partner_name"}} PARTNER 4 {{/doc_var}} residing at {{#doc_var name="fourth_partner_address"}} ADDRESS 4 {{/doc_var}} {{/doc_select}} ("the Partners")

WHEREAS the parties to this Agreement wish to carry on business of {{#doc_var name="business_description"}} BUSINESS DESCRIPTION{{/doc_var}} in partnership together under the name of {{#doc_var name="business_name"}} NAME OF BUSINESS {{/doc_var}} ("the Partnership") subject to the terms and conditions of this Agreement.

NOW THEREFORE the parties HAVE AGREED and do hereby CONTRACT as follows:

  1. ESTABLISHMENT OF PARTNERSHIP
    1. The Partners have agreed to carry on the business of {{#doc_var name="business_description"}} BUSINESS {{/doc_var}} in partnership together with effect from {{#doc_var name="business_commencement_date"}} DATE {{/doc_var}}.
    2. The Partnership's business shall be carried on at {{#doc_var name="business_address"}} ADDRESS OF BUSINESS {{/doc_var}} or at such other place or places as the Partners may from time to time agree.
  2. DURATION

    The Partnership shall commence on {{#doc_var name="business_commencement_date"}} PARTNERSHIP START DATE {{/doc_var}} and shall subsist until dissolved in accordance with the terms of clause 10 of this Agreement.

  3. INVOLVEMENT IN PARTNERSHIP BUSINESS

    Each Partner shall at all times:

    1. be just and faithful to the other Partners in all matters relating to the Partnership and shall give a true account of the same when reasonably required to do so by the other Partners;
    2. devote a reasonable time to carrying on the business of the Partnership;
    3. conduct himself or herself in a proper and responsible manner and use his or her best endeavours to promote the business of the Partnership for the utmost benefit of the Partnership;
    4. be entitled to subscribe the Partnership name for all the usual business purposes of the Partnership but the Partnership name shall not be used by any Partner otherwise than for the proper business of the Partnership.
  4. DECISIONS

    All matters relating to the management and conduct of the affairs of the Partnership shall be decided by a majority vote taken at a meeting of the Partners except that the assumption of a new Partner shall require the consent of each of the Partners. The quorum for any meeting of Partners shall consist of {{#doc_var name="quorum_number"}} QUORUM NUMBER {{/doc_var}} Partners present in person but where any Partner is unable to attend he or she may appoint another Partner as his or her proxy to vote on his or her behalf. Any decision or wishes ascertained at a quorate meeting of Partners shall bind any Partner not present thereat and shall thereafter represent the wishes of all the Partners.

  5. BANK ACCOUNTS
    1. All bank accounts required by the Partnership shall be maintained with {{#doc_var name="bank"}} NAME OF BANK {{/doc_var}} and shall be opened with the bankers in the Partnership name and all cheques and securities for money shall be promptly paid into the Partnership's bank accounts or deposited in the Partnership's name with the bankers.
    2. Each Partner shall have the right to sign cheques and withdrawal slips and generally the right to operate on all such accounts.
    3. All cheques shall be drawn in the name of the Partnership and the signature of {{#doc_var name="signatures"}} NUMBER OF SIGNATURES {{/doc_var}} Partners shall be required on each cheque.
  6. CAPITAL
    1. The capital of the Partnership shall be contributed by the Partners in such proportions and in such manner and shall consist of such sum or sums as they shall from time to time agree.
    2. The assets of the Partnership, including goodwill and the premises in which the Partnership business is carried on, shall be Partnership property and shall (unless otherwise agreed) belong to the Partners jointly or shall (if vested in any individual Partner) be held in trust for all other Partners and the other Partners shall indemnify such Partner against all liability which may arise whether directly or indirectly out of such ownership.
  7. PROFITS AND LOSSES
    1. In respect of each accounting period of the Partnership, the Partners shall be paid out of the profits of the Partnership, salaries of the following amount: {{#doc_select name="partners_profits_losses" label="" multi="true"}} {{#doc_var name="first_partner_name"}} PARTNER 1 {{/doc_var}} {{#doc_var name="first_partner_salary"}} AMOUNT 1 {{/doc_var}}, {option} {{#doc_var name="second_partner_name"}} PARTNER 2 {{/doc_var}} {{#doc_var name="second_partner_salary"}} AMOUNT 2 {{/doc_var}} {option} , {{#doc_var name="third_partner_name"}} PARTNER 3 {{/doc_var}} {{#doc_var name="third_partner_salary"}} AMOUNT 3 {{/doc_var}} {option} , {{#doc_var name="fourth_partner_name"}} PARTNER 4 {{/doc_var}} {{#doc_var name="fourth_partner_salary"}} AMOUNT 4 {{/doc_var}} . {{/doc_select}}
    2. The salaries (or such other monthly sums as the Partners may from time to time agree in writing) shall be paid monthly in arrears.
    3. Where there are insufficient profits to meet in full the salaries provided for in clause 7.1 in respect of any accounting period of the Partnership, the salaries for such accounting period shall be reduced proportionately so that the total does not exceed the amount of the available profits of the Partnership.
    4. After the Partners' salaries have been paid under this clause, the Partners shall share the profits and losses of the Partnership, whether income or capital, equally.
    5. Each Partner shall be entitled to make such drawings against his or her entitlement to profit as the Partners shall agree.
  8. ACCOUNTING RECORDS
    1. The Partners shall ensure that proper accounting records are kept showing all transactions of the Partnership and the capital and current accounts of each Partner. All records and accounts of the Partnership shall be maintained and kept at the Partnership's premises or at such other location as the Partners may from time to time agree.
    2. On {{#doc_var name="accounting_date"}} ACCOUNTING DATE {{/doc_var}} ("the Accounting Date") in each year, a profit and loss account and a balance sheet shall be taken and made of all the assets and liabilities of the Partnership for the accounting period, and shall be prepared by such accountants as the Partners may agree.
    3. Each Partner shall be entitled to receive a copy of the accounts of the Partnership for each accounting period as soon as reasonably practicable and in any event not later than three months after the Accounting Date on which that period ended.
    4. Unless objections to any accounts are made in writing by any Partner within 14 days of the provision of a copy of such accounts under clause 8.3, the accounts will for all purposes be deemed to have been accepted and approved by all Partners. If objections are made by any Partner within that period, the matters in dispute shall be referred to an arbitrator appointed under clause 12, and the accounts, as adjusted, if necessary, to reflect the arbitrator's decision, shall thereafter be deemed to have been accepted and approved by all Partners.
  9. PROHIBITED ACTS
    1. No Partner shall:
      1. employ any of the money or assets of the Partnership or pledge the credit thereof except in the normal course of business of the Partnership;
      2. borrow or obtain any money for his or her own private purposes by signing or using the Partnership name;
      3. give any guarantee or security on behalf of the Partnership except in the normal course of business;
      4. knowingly permit anything to be done whereby the Partnership property or any part thereof may be subject to execution or otherwise endangered;
      5. assign or charge his or her share in the Partnership or any part thereof;
      6. compromise or compound or release or discharge any debt due to the Partnership;
      7. enter into any bond or bail or become a guarantor for any person; or
      8. offer, promise, give, request, agree to receive or accept any bribes and each Partner agrees to remain bound by the laws of the UK relevant to countering bribery and corruption, including the Bribery Act 2010.
    2. If any Partner shall act in any way contrary to the provisions of clause 9.1, he or she shall free and relieve the Partnership, and, as applicable, the other Partners, of and from any loss or liability sustained or incurred by it or him or her (as the case may be) or any claim by a third party against the Partnership or the other Partners arising out of or in connection with such breach.
    3. If any Partner shall:
      1. become bankrupt or enter into any compromise or arrangement with or for the benefit of his or her creditors; or
      2. commit any serious breach or persistent breaches of this Agreement; or
      3. do any act prohibited by clause 9.1;
      4. he or she shall be deemed to have retired from the Partnership if the other Partners shall give such Partner notice to that effect, and such retiral shall be effective as at the date of such notice.
  10. CONSEQUENCES OF DEATH OR RETIRAL
    1. Without prejudice to clause 10.2 any Partner may retire upon giving not less than {{#doc_var name="retirement_notice"}} NUMBER OF MONTHS {{/doc_var}} months' written notice to the other Partners.
    2. Where a Partner dies or retires after giving notice as provided for in clause 10.1 or is deemed to have retired pursuant to clause 9.3, the remaining Partners may elect within two months of the date of death or retiral ("the succession date") either":
      1. to wind up the Partnership in accordance with Section 44 of the Partnership Act 1890; or
      2. to carry on the business and to take over the whole assets (including the goodwill and Partnership name) and liabilities of the Partnership, to the exclusion of the deceased or retired Partner.
    3. If the remaining Partners elect to carry on the business in accordance with clause 10.2.2 a profit and loss account and balance sheet shall be prepared in accordance with clause 8 as at the succession date as if the succession date was an accounting date, but no amount shall be included in respect of goodwill or the Partnership name, nor shall there be any revaluation of any assets belonging to the Partnership.
    4. The value of the share and interest of the deceased or retiring Partner in the Partnership as brought out in such balance sheet shall be payable to the estate of the deceased Partner or to the retiring Partner by the remaining Partners by four equal instalments, the first such instalment being payable on the date one year after the succession date. No interest shall be payable by the remaining Partners on the amount so due.
    5. The retiring Partner shall be bound to execute and deliver to the remaining Partners all documents which require to be signed and shall take all action which may be necessary to secure the transfer of the assets of the Partnership to the remaining Partners.
  11. TERMINATION
    1. Subject to the foregoing provisions, in the event of the termination of the Partnership the affairs thereof shall be wound up in accordance with Section 44 of the Partnership Act 1890.
    2. Notice of dissolution of the Partnership or of the fact that a Partner has retired or deceased shall be advertised in the London Gazette and so far as reasonably practicable by letter to all persons and bodies which have dealt with the Partnership.
  12. ARBITRATION

    In the event of any dispute or difference arising between the Partners or between a retiring Partner or a former Partner and the remaining Partners as to the true intent and meaning of this Agreement or as to the rights or obligations of the Partners hereunder, whether during the existence of the Partnership or after its termination, such dispute or difference, including any question as to damages, shall be referred to an arbitrator to be nominated failing Agreement by the Chartered Institute of Arbitrators in accordance with the Rules of the Chartered Institute of Arbitrators and the decision of the arbitrator (including a decision that the Partnership should be dissolved) shall be final and binding on all Partners including any retiring Partner or former Partner.

  13. ASSIGNMENT

    This Agreement shall be binding on and shall enure for the benefit of the legal personal representatives, heirs and estates of each of the parties hereto but no Partner shall be entitled to assign the benefit or burden of this Agreement.

  14. GOVERNING LAW

    This Agreement shall be governed by and construed in accordance with English law. IN WITNESS WHEREOF these presents are executed as a deed on the date before written.
